block.p: Kristin Elizabeth Noonan, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank R. Noonan of Purchase, N.Y., was married yesterday in Cambridge, Mass., to Matthew Parke Hall, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael P. Hall of Concord, N.H. The Rev. Lee A. Bluemel, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at the Memorial Church at Harvard University.

Mrs. Hall, 26, is to begin her second year in the M.B.A. program at Harvard in September. She graduated from Bowdoin College. Her father is the chairman and chief executive of R. H. Donnelley, a company in Purchase that prints the New York Yellow Pages. Her mother, Patricia S. Noonan, is an independent book editor in Purchase.

Kristin Elizabeth Noonan, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank R. Noonan of Purchase, N.Y., was married yesterday in Cambridge, Mass., to Matthew Parke Hall, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael P. Hall of Concord, N.H. The Rev. Lee A. Bluemel, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at the Memorial Church at Harvard University.

Mrs. Hall, 26, is to begin her second year in the M.B.A. program at Harvard in September. She graduated from Bowdoin College. Her father is the chairman and chief executive of R. H. Donnelley, a company in Purchase that prints the New York Yellow Pages. Her mother, Patricia S. Noonan, is an independent book editor in Purchase.

Mr. Hall, 27, is the vice president for business development at Publications Resource Group, an online provider of market research in North Adams, Mass. He graduated from Williams College. His mother, Laura L. Hall, is a judicial clerk for the Federal District Court in Concord, N.H. His father is a partner in Hall, Hess, Stewart, Murphy & Brown, a law firm in Manchester, N.H.
